channel.title: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?
channel.description: What do you think? Should Jagex release EOC as different version and keep the old version, similar how they did it with RSC?

item.title: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?
item.dc:creator: @xI_c_E xI c E
item.description:
@xI_c_E wrote:

Yes, it should. I stopped playing RS awhile ago because of how much they changed it. EOC will ruin RS because it doesn’t fit the game.

Read full topic
item.source: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?

item.title: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:33, topic:462785”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=566004.msg4122978#msg4122978 date=1349991462]

The reason your probably all angry at RS3 being released is because your not used to it enough. You’ve all played RS2 for so long that the big change sounds bad, it happened with classic -> RS2 and it’s happening with RS2 -> RS3

Didn’t a lot of players quit from that switch? They will do so again, but this update will draw other new players to play. So it’s all gonna balance out

Correct.

It took about a year to gain the players they lost from rsc. Will jagex investors wait a year on a gamble? Probably not…
[/quote]They’re doing it either way, and my guess is the investors already know about it :P[/quote]

Good to hear.

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:27, topic:462785”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=566004.msg4122630#msg4122630 date=1349925754]

They have already confirmed it will come out this month so you might as well stop arguing.

Where did Jagex state this? Not that I’m disagreeing with you, It’s just that when I tell people, they always want proof lol. I enjoy the beta, minus a few things like gaining exp after you have killed the monster, prayers not protecting 100% on most monsters, and minor bugs, but that’s about it.
[/quote]it said it in the october news thingy…[/quote]No it didn’t? At least not from what I can read…

item.description:

Only if jagex sorts things out, action bar is boring if there is no rotation or buffs. If you play WoW you will know what im talking about. In the beta its just spamming ability’s, doesn’t make the game better.

item.title: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:8, topic:462785”][quote author=Rich link=topic=566004.msg4117248#msg4117248 date=1349195181]
Slightly related: I haven’t played much in a long time. Why exactly is everyone so upset about EoC? I played it for a bit and thought it was awesome, but it seems the majority of the community hates it. Why is this?
[/quote]

People hate change. IMO, It’s a lot of effort for pretty much not a lot. There are other ways to make it possible for what they want to do without changing the main core of combat. (new bosses etc)[/quote]

People are fucking stupid. If life changes why can’t a game?

item.title: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Transformers Universe (video game)

Transformers Universe was a multiplayer online battle arena (MOBA) developed by British game developer Jagex in partnership with American toy company Hasbro. The game was officially unveiled at Auto Assembly 2010, the game went into closed beta on March 12, 2014 and entered open beta on July 4, 2014. The game shut down on January 31, 2015. Gameplay was team-based with players choosing to fight on behalf of the Autobots or Decepticons. The game offered both PVP and PVE gameplay, with the emphasi...

just an interesting read that apparently Runescape is behind in Runetek upgrades.

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Squirt Ltd, post:17, topic:462785”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=566004.msg4119995#msg4119995 date=1349586771]
that may be an internal name but it would truly be foolish of them to try and call it publically Runescape 3, Last time it cuased much confusion and plenty of opportunity for scammers and phishers.
[/quote]

yea i remember seeing tons of rs3 “beta” sites just before the hd update lmao
anyways they arent gonna make a server for rs2, if they did it should be rev500-[/quote]
STOP it.
If they make a “RS2” server, it would be the last revision before EoC. Picking any other is juts foolish.

item.source: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?

item.title: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:14, topic:462785”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=566004.msg4118157#msg4118157 date=1349324708]
I believe they should wait for EoC to be released with RS3. Not only will it complement the new RuneScape well, but you could keep the old combat for those players that are stubborn on like 2 servers for RS2. Same deal from classic -> RS2.
[/quote]
Jagex will never make the mistake of calling a game RS3 nor will they make the same mistake they did with keeping classic open again.[/quote]
Well MMG said “The project name is RS3 but what we end up calling it is yet to be seen.” And I just read the transcript about the future of RuneScape, and it seems you are right. They have no plans on keeping RS2 on a few servers like classic because they feel that the majority of the changes they are making are wanted. Here’s a whole quote on the matter.

"1. If the Evolution of Combat is not RS3, what are the major marks or distinctions of RS3?

MMG: The project name is RS3 but what we end up calling it is yet to be seen. We’re trying to bundle together our most formidable update that we’ve ever done both technically, be that graphics or audio, controller input, the full works as well as also some really compelling content. Clearly, the Evolution of Combat (EoC) is a big step forward towards what we’re trying to do but we’re also hoping to have some really interesting and innovative content too that we haven’t spoken about yet and we think that our players will really appreciate.

Mark: We’re really looking for an improved experience for the players, so we’re talking about updated audio, full tunes. I listened to an absolutely amazing few tracks the other day. New tunes for the website, new tunes for the opening experience of the game. We’re also looking at a new top level interface, so new ways for players to interact with the product and also things like an improved world map. It’s really improving those things that you experience and take for granted every day when you’re playing RuneScape. As Mark says, we’re also looking for some really cool pieces of content to put alongside that. I’m keeping my cards a bit close to my chest, really, in terms of what we’ve got planned. 2013 is going to be a massive year for RuneScape. There’s going to be some really, really big things happening from a storytelling perspective and also the game play of RuneScape. From all the years I’ve been here, I’ve never been so excited about a year’s worth of content. RuneScape 3 is just the tip of the iceberg. It’s what we’re going to start with and then you’ll see all the cool stuff that we’ve got planned for the rest of the year. "

Read full topic
item.source: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?

item.title: Should EOC be released as seperate version of RS?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

The Wanderer:

I believe they should wait for EoC to be released with RS3. Not only will it complement the new RuneScape well, but you could keep the old combat for those players that are stubborn on like 2 servers for RS2. Same deal from classic -> RS2.

Jagex will never make the mistake of calling a game RS3 nor will they make the same mistake they did with keeping classic open again.

Read full topic
